member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo
member.summary: Utility class for obtaining information about the currently running process and AppDomain

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.UNKNOWN
member.summary: Returns the string '[Unknown]'

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ProcessId
member.summary: Returns the current process id

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ProcessName
member.summary: Returns the current process name without an extension

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ProcessFile
member.summary: Returns the file path to the exe for this process

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.AppDomainName
member.summary: Returns the current AppDomain's friendly name

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.EntryAssembly
member.summary: Returns the entry-point assembly or the highest stack assembly

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ProductVersion
member.summary: Returns the product version of the entry assembly

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ProductName
member.summary: Returns the product name of the entry assembly

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.CompanyName
member.summary: Returns the company name of the entry assembly

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.IsDebugging
member.summary: Returns true if a debugger is attached to the process

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.RegistrySoftwarePath
member.summary: Returns the HKCU or HKLM path for this software application based on the process that is running: Software\{CompanyName}\{ProductName}

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.ApplicationData
member.summary: Returns the roaming user profile path for the currently running software application: {SpecialFolder.ApplicationData}\{CompanyName}\{ProductName}

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.LocalApplicationData
member.summary: Returns the non-roaming user profile path for the currently running software application: {SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData}\{CompanyName}\{ProductName}

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.DefaultLogFile
member.summary: Returns a default log file name derived as: {SpecialFolder.LocalApplicationData}\{CompanyName}\{ProductName}\{AppDomainName}.txt

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Utils.ProcessInfo.#ctor
member.summary: This is some ugly code, the intent is to be able to answer the above questions in a wide array of environments. I admit now this may fail eventually.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs
member.summary: Defines the various possble outputs of the logging system

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.None
member.summary: No default destination (Event will still fire if anyone is subscribed)

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.TraceWrite
member.summary: Outputs messages to the System.Diagnostics.Trace.WriteLine() method
member.remarks: Note: Always on by default when System.Diagnostics.Debugger.IsAttached == true

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.LogFile
member.summary: Outputs messages to this process' log file
member.remarks: Note: Always on by default to \Users\{Current}\AppData\Local\{Process Name}\{Process File Name}.log

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.Console
member.summary: Outputs messages to the Console.[Out/Error].WriteLine() methods
member.remarks: Note: Always on by default when running as a console application

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.AspNetTrace
member.summary: Outputs messages to the System.Web.HttpContext.Current.Trace.[Write/Warn]() methods
member.remarks: Note: Always on by default when /configuration/system.web/trace/@enabled == true

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.EventLog
member.summary: Outputs messages to the event log
member.remarks: Note: Always on by default for Critical errors only

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs.All
member.summary: Writes to all LogOutput types available

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions
member.summary: Performance and behavior related LogOption for the log system.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.Default
member.summary: These are the default options used. Addtionally, if your debugging or using asp.net trace, the following will also be set: LogAddFileInfo

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.None
member.summary: No LogOption enabled

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.LogImmediateCaller
member.summary: Calls new StackFrame( n ) to retrieve the immediate caller of the log routine and pass it along to all logging information.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.LogNearestCaller
member.summary: Starting with n frames back walk back until the calling class is not decorated with the ////[System.Diagnostics.DebuggerNonUserCode()] attribute. This allows you to create wrapper classes that provide logging but are not considered to be the point of origin in the log. Can be slightly slower as this now reflects each class' attributes and addtionally may gather more than one stack frame.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.LogAddFileInfo
member.summary: If this is specified the file and line number where the log call was made will be available to log LogOutput.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.ConsoleColors
member.summary: Uses a different color based on the level of the log message, Use ONLY nothing else is writting to the console.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.LogAddAssemblyInfo
member.summary: Populate the MethodAssemblyVersion and MethodAssembly properties for logging. Requires at least the LogImmediateCaller information.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOptions.GZipLogFileOnRoll
member.summary: GZip and append a .gz extension to log files as they are rolled, the current log file will remain unzipped.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue
member.summary:
NOTE TO READER:
I will appologize up front for this library. I don't normally condone this type of proceedural and repetitive coding. This is ONLY being done in this library to reduce the temporal cost of using it. In a nutshell: this being easy to maintain is not as important as library performance.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.ListenerSync
member.summary: This allows for async subscriptions to InternalLogWrite event

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.__eventCounter
member.summary: Keeps a running counter of events and assigns a unique one to each log entry

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue._logFile
member.summary: If logging configured to disk, we manage the currently open log file here

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.LogFileSync
member.summary: Used to syncronize access to log file while writting log entries and changing the log file

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.WorkerThreadProc
member.summary: This thread proc manages the pumping of messages to the listeners, this is ONLY available when StartThreading() has been called via constructor of a ThreadingControl() object, (client calls Log.AppStart( name ))

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.StartThreading
member.summary: This is NOT thread safe, locking is done through ThreadingControl

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.StopThreading
member.summary: This is NOT thread safe, locking is done through ThreadingControl

member.name: E:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.MessageQueue.InternalLogWrite
member.summary: This is the actual event list we will dispatch to when logs are written

member.name: T:Log
member.summary: Provides an abstraction api for logging to various outputs. This class in the global namespace for a reason. Since you may want to change log infrastructure at any time, it's important that no 'Using' statements are required to access the log infrastructure. Secondly, a static class api can provide improved performance over other possible types. We will be forcing the default configuration of log4net rather than requiring each component to independently configure itself.

member.name: M:Log.AppStart(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Enables calls to Log.xxx() to be processed on another thread to improve throughput... Place this in a using() statement within Main: using( new Log.AppStart("Some Name") ) This call (and Disponse) IS Thread safe and can be called multiple times either concurrently, sequentially, nested, or overlapping calls are all permitted and handled.

member.name: M:Log.Start(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Pushes a string into the trace stack so that log messages appear with the 'context' set to the information provided. The operation named should be performed by the current thread and the IDisposable object returned should be disposed when the operation completes.
member.returns: An IDisposable object that should be destroyed by calling the Dispose() method when the activity is complete.

member.name: M:Log.ClearStack
member.summary: Forces any left-behind calls to Start() to be closed.

member.name: M:Log.Write(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Write directly to the log reguardless of the currently configured log-LogLevel

member.name: E:Log.LogWrite
member.summary: This event is raised when the logging routines are called and the LogLevel is at or higher than the current Log.LogLevels field value.

member.name: P:Log.IsInfoEnabled
member.summary: Returns true if 'Info' messages are being recorded.

member.name: P:Log.IsVerboseEnabled
member.summary: Returns true if 'Verbose' messages are being recorded.

member.name: T:Log.Config
member.summary: Provides configuration options for the Log subsystem

member.name: M:Log.Config.SetOutputLevel(CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs,CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogLevels)
member.summary: Changes the log level required to write to a specific output device.

member.name: M:Log.Config.SetOutputFormat(CSharpTest.Net.Logging.LogOutputs,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the output format used to write to a specific output device. The format of this string behaves just like EventData.ToString(). The string can contain any public field or property available for the CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData class surrounded by braces {} and yes, properties/fields are case sensative. The input string should look something like the following examples: "[{ManagedThreadId:D2}] {Level,8} - {Message}{Location}{Exception}" -- this is the default format of ToString() "{EventTime:o} [{ProcessId:D4},{ManagedThreadId:D2}] {Level,8} - {Message}{Location}{Exception}" -- This is the default log file format.

member.name: P:Log.Config.Level
member.summary: Gets or sets the current log LogLevel

member.name: P:Log.Config.Output
member.summary: Gets or sets the current log LogLevel

member.name: P:Log.Config.Options
member.summary:
Gets or sets the availability of stack info etc. The following performance characterists were taken with a simple example app running 10 threads each writing 1000 log statements in a tight-loop. The times below reflect threading enabled (someone having called Log.AppStart()). The following hardware was used: AMD Turion 64x2 TL-62 2.10 GHz, 3 GB RAM running Vista 32-bit SP1 (HP Notebook). The time indicated below was estimated by taking the total number of milliseconds until all threads completed and dividing by the 10,000 messages that were written.
Cost per call 0.005 ms with no context (None)
Cost per call 0.035 ms with calling method (LogImmediateCaller)
Cost per call 0.060 ms with calling method & assembly info (LogImmediateCaller | LogAddAssemblyInfo)
Cost per call 0.160 ms with calling method & file info (LogImmediateCaller | LogAddFileInfo)
Cost per call 0.190 ms with calling method & assembly info & file info (LogImmediateCaller | LogAddAssemblyInfo | LogAddFileInfo)

member.name: P:Log.Config.FormatProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets the format provider to use when formatting strings

member.name: P:Log.Config.LogFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the current log file name, insert '{0}' in the file's name to allow log rolling

member.name: P:Log.Config.LogFileMaxSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size in bytes the log file is allowed to be before rolling to history

member.name: P:Log.Config.LogFileMaxHistory
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of history log files to keep on the system

member.name: P:Log.Config.EventLogName
member.summary: Sets the event log name we will write events to.

member.name: P:Log.Config.EventLogSource
member.summary: Sets the event log source we will write events with, It's up to you to register this value.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData
member.summary: This is the class that is used to transfer log events through the system. It's basically a 'picture' of the state at the time the log was written since all logging is actually happening in a delayed fashion.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.#cctor
member.summary: Asserts that the LogFields enumeration has the same fields as this class

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.Level
member.summary: The LogLevel of the log data or LogLevels.None if Log.Write() was called

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.Output
member.summary: The outputs that should recieve this message

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.ToObjectArray
member.summary: Used for string formatting, the order of these MUST match the order of names return by FieldNames

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.ToString
member.summary: Displays this log data in a default brief format

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.EventData.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Displays this log data in a specific format. Use '{FieldName}' to be substituded with it's value. Sorry but it uses a case-sensitive match of fields in this class.

member.summary: Writes this log data in a specific format. Use '{FieldName}' to be substituded with it's value. Sorry but it uses a case-sensitive match of fields in this class.

member.summary: Writes a custom xml format for this record.

member.summary: Returns this data as an XmlWriter text fragment who name is the class name and each attribute is the field name, again maintaining the case.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.SharedException
member.summary: Exceptions of any kind are turned into this when serialized to another process... This is intentional to prevent issues of crossing .Net versions as well as simple client coding mistakes (Non-Serializable Exceptions).

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Logging.Implementation.VersionInfo
member.summary: This is a small utility class for computing a hash of the fields to prevent different versions from having issues durring de-serialization.
